ArticleTitle.sentence: Transcriptional regulation of the pyruvate kinase erythroid-specific promoter.

event.clue: Transcriptional regulation of the pyruvate kinase erythroid-specific promoter.

AbstractText.sentence: Mammal pyruvate kinases are encoded by two genes.
The L gene produces the erythroid (R-PK) or the hepatic (L-PK) isozymes by the alternative use of two promoters.

event.clue: The L gene produces the erythroid (R-PK) or the hepatic (L-PK) isozymes by the alternative use of two promoters.
The L gene produces the erythroid (R-PK) or the hepatic (L-PK) isozymes by the alternative use of two promoters.
The L gene produces the erythroid (R-PK) or the hepatic (L-PK) isozymes by the alternative use of two promoters.
The L gene produces the erythroid (R-PK) or the hepatic (L-PK) isozymes by the alternative use of two promoters.

AbstractText.sentence: We report the characterization of the cis- and trans-acting elements involved in the tissue-specific activity of the L gene erythroid promoter.

event.clue: We report the characterization of the cis- and trans-acting elements involved in the tissue-specific activity of the L gene erythroid promoter.
We report the characterization of the cis- and trans-acting elements involved in the tissue-specific activity of the L gene erythroid promoter.
We report the characterization of the cis- and trans-acting elements involved in the tissue-specific activity of the L gene erythroid promoter.

AbstractText.sentence: A R-PK DNA fragment extending from -870 to +54 relative to the cap site confers erythroid specificity to a reporter gene.

event.clue: A R-PK DNA fragment extending from -870 to +54 relative to the cap site confers erythroid specificity to a reporter gene.
A R-PK DNA fragment extending from -870 to +54 relative to the cap site confers erythroid specificity to a reporter gene.

AbstractText.sentence: Within this region, we define a minimal promoter (-62 to +54) that displays erythroid-specific activity and contains two DNA binding sites.

event.clue: Within this region, we define a minimal promoter (-62 to +54) that displays erythroid-specific activity and contains two DNA binding sites.

AbstractText.sentence: One, located at -50, binds members of the CCACC/Sp1 family and the other, located at -20, binds the erythroid factor GATA-1.

event.clue: One, located at -50, binds members of the CCACC/Sp1 family and the other, located at -20, binds the erythroid factor GATA-1.
One, located at -50, binds members of the CCACC/Sp1 family and the other, located at -20, binds the erythroid factor GATA-1.

AbstractText.sentence: Although the -20 GATA binding site (AGATAA) is also a potential TFIID binding site, it does not bind TFIID.

event.clue: Although the -20 GATA binding site (AGATAA) is also a potential TFIID binding site, it does not bind TFIID.

AbstractText.sentence: Furthermore, the substitution of this GATA binding site by a canonical TFIID binding site suppresses the promoter activity.

event.clue: Furthermore, the substitution of this GATA binding site by a canonical TFIID binding site suppresses the promoter activity.
Furthermore, the substitution of this GATA binding site by a canonical TFIID binding site suppresses the promoter activity.

AbstractText.sentence: Mutations and deletions of both sites indicate that only the association of CCACC/Sp1 and GATA binding sites can drive efficient and tissue-specific expression of this R-PK minimal promoter.

event.clue: Mutations and deletions of both sites indicate that only the association of CCACC/Sp1 and GATA binding sites can drive efficient and tissue-specific expression of this R-PK minimal promoter.

AbstractText.sentence: Finally, by co-transfection experiments, we study the elements involved in the hGATA-1 transactivation of the R-PK promoter in HeLa cells.

event.clue: Finally, by co-transfection experiments, we study the elements involved in the hGATA-1 transactivation of the R-PK promoter in HeLa cells.
